attractions.name: Eling Park (鹅岭公园)
attractions.location: Yuzhong District, Metro Line 1 Eling Station Exit 1
attractions.notes: FREE. Open 6:00-22:00. Panoramic 360° views from Eling Tower. Best views of Yangtze & Jialing rivers confluence. Tea house and restaurants available. Perfect for jet lag recovery - relaxing, scenic, niche local favorite.

attractions.name: Longmenhao Old Street (龙门浩老街)
attractions.notes: FREE. Former Italian & American embassy area with exotic vibe. Old US Embassy converted to café. Different atmosphere day vs night. Hidden gem foreigners love but only locals know.

attractions.name: TESTBED2 Arts Center (贰厂文创公园)
attractions.notes: FREE. Trendy creative space with 100+ unique businesses, galleries, art spaces, designer boutiques, cafes. Smart city micro-renewal project integrating contemporary culture. Very niche and fancy, perfect for INFJ.

attractions.name: Beicang Creative Park (北仓文创园)
attractions.notes: FREE. Over 40 independent designer boutiques, bilingual art workshops. Known as 'Dopamine Street' for vibrant hues. Creative hub with art galleries, studios, unique shops. Hidden gem off Google Maps.

attractions.name: Nankan Grottoes (南龛石窟)
attractions.location: Nankan Mountain, southern suburb of Bazhong
attractions.notes: Tang Dynasty (618-907) Buddhist grottoes. 122 intact niches with 1,800 Buddha statues carved in cliff face. Located at Nankan Park. Best to visit in morning before high-speed rail to Chengdu. Ticket ~30 RMB (€4).

attractions.name: Guangwu Mountain (光雾山) - OPTIONAL
attractions.location: Nanjiang County, Bazhong (1.5 hours from city)
attractions.notes: OPTIONAL if time permits. National 5A scenic area, world geopark. Famous for karst peaks, waterfalls, canyon. Best for red leaves Oct-Nov but winter scenery beautiful. Consider only if early train allows time.

attractions.name: Enyang Ancient Town (恩阳古镇) - ALTERNATIVE
attractions.notes: FREE. Alternative if pressed for time. Traditional architecture, ancient streets. Red Army revolutionary heritage. Authentic local atmosphere. Quicker visit option.

attractions.name: Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding (大熊猫繁育研究基地)
attractions.notes: CRITICAL: Arrive 9:00 AM sharp. Feb hours: 8:00-17:30. Adult ticket 55 RMB (~€7). FREE for 60+ with ID. BOOK ONLINE 14 days advance via WeChat/Trip.com/Meituan. Daily limit 60,000 (30k morning/30k afternoon). Best feeding time 7:30-10:00. Plan exactly 1 hour as specified.

attractions.name: Jinli Ancient Street (锦里古街)
attractions.notes: FREE. Open 24/7 but shops/restaurants close 22:00. Traditional Sichuan architecture, local snacks, tea houses, crafts. Near Wuhou Temple. Authentic atmosphere, good for photos.

attractions.name: Kuanzhai Alley (宽窄巷子)
attractions.notes: OPTIONAL. FREE. Open 24/7, shops 9:00-22:00. Three parallel alleys: Wide, Narrow, Well. Qing Dynasty architecture, teahouses, boutiques. If time allows after Jinli.

attractions.name: Taikoo Li Chengdu (太古里)
attractions.notes: FREE. Modern outdoor shopping complex as planned for evening. Blend of high-end retail and local culture. International brands and local designers. Open-air walkable area.

attractions.name: The Bund (外滩)
attractions.notes: FREE. Open 24/7. BEST after 6pm when Pudong buildings light up. 1.5km waterfront promenade. 52 colonial buildings in Gothic/baroque/neoclassical styles. Spectacular futuristic Pudong skyline views. Metro Line 2/10 East Nanjing Road Station.

attractions.name: People's Square (人民广场)
attractions.notes: FREE. Central Shanghai location. Pass through en route. Shanghai Museum located here (free but book ahead). Good for orientation.

attractions.name: Tianzifang (田子坊)
attractions.notes: FREE. Labyrinthine alleyways in traditional shikumen architecture. 29 art studios, 58 craft shops, 65 antique shops, 65+ cafes/bars. Independent designer boutiques. SOHO of Shanghai. Very niche, INFJ-friendly, authentic local vibe.

attractions.name: Rockbund Art Museum (外滩美术馆)
attractions.location: No. 20 Huqiu Road, near The Bund
attractions.notes: ~100 RMB (€13-15). Former Royal Asiatic Society building (1933). Contemporary art exhibitions. Niche cultural experience near Bund. Check opening hours before visit.

attractions.name: Café del Volcán
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. French-inspired exterior, edgy interior. One of Shanghai's finest specialty coffee spots. INFJ perfect.

attractions.name: Rumors Coffee Roastery
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Hidden gem in French Concession. Exceptional hand-brewed coffee and roasting. Sacred ground for serious coffee drinkers. INFJ perfect hideaway.

attractions.name: Shanghai Disneyland (上海迪士尼乐园)
attractions.notes: FULL DAY. Open 8:30-21:30 (hours vary). February = LOW SEASON = cheapest tickets 475-550 RMB (~$59-70/€55-65). Children <3 free, 3-11 and 65+ discounted. BOOK ONLINE ADVANCE - sells out high-demand dates. Early Park Entry Pass +149 CNY (enter 90 min early). Flexible refund policy from Jan 12, 2026.

attractions.name: Museum of Art Pudong (浦东美术馆/MAP)
attractions.location: No. 2777 Binjiang Avenue, Lujiazui riverside, Pudong
attractions.notes: 100-150 RMB (~€13-20). Designed by Pritzker winner Jean Nouvel (opened July 2021). 13 exhibition halls, 10,000+ sqm. Top floor: views of Bund & Oriental Pearl Tower. Modern niche cultural experience perfect for INFJ. Call 400-820-8771 for hours/exhibitions.

attractions.name: UNO Garden Bookstore
attractions.notes: FREE (purchases optional). Cozy villa ~100 years old, fireplace. Tranquil neighborhood with parasol trees. English books available. Perfect niche INFJ spot, authentic local experience.

attractions.name: Banana Fish Bookstore
attractions.notes: FREE. Independent art bookstore. Focuses on independent magazines, niche publishers. Art enthusiasts' paradise. Small curated selection. English-language art publications.

attractions.name: iRen Study (伊人书店)
attractions.notes: FREE. 24-hour unattended bookstore, only 14 sqm. Name from MBTI (introverts). Perfect INFJ personality spot. Unique experience for introverts.

attractions.name: Shanghai Foreign Language Book Store
attractions.notes: FREE. Entire building dedicated to English books - business, classics, romance, cookbooks, bestsellers. Widest selection.

attractions.name: POP MART Shanghai Flagship
attractions.notes: €10-20 budget. 2-level global flagship store. Exclusive collectibles. Sonny Angel, blind boxes. Perfect for cute toy lovers.

attractions.name: Metal Hands Coffee
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Top 50 Coffee Shops Worldwide - ONLY Chinese mainland shop on list. World-class quality. Must-visit for coffee enthusiasts.

attractions.name: The Press Café
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Beautifully restored former newspaper office. Unique atmosphere. Amazing coffee and breakfast. Niche spot.

attractions.name: Forbidden City (故宫)
attractions.location: Dongcheng District, Meridian Gate south entrance
attractions.notes: Feb low season: 40 RMB (~€5). CRITICAL: BOOK ONLINE 1-7 days advance at bookingticket.dpm.org.cn - NO walk-up tickets. Foreigners: passport + email only. 40,000 daily limit. Often sold out weeks ahead peak season. Passport scan for entry. Plan 3-4 hours minimum. UNESCO World Heritage.

attractions.name: Nanluoguxiang (南锣鼓巷)
attractions.notes: FREE. Open 24/7. Most popular Beijing hutong, 740+ years history. Traditional alleyways, boutiques, cafes, bars. Metro Line 6/8 Nanluoguxiang Station Exit E. Easy walk from Forbidden City. ALTERNATIVE: Beiluoguxiang (less crowded).

attractions.name: 798 Art District (798艺术区)
attractions.notes: FREE general entry (galleries may charge). Nearly 200 galleries, exhibitions, art centers in former factory. Creative architecture, stylish boutiques, cafes, bookstores. Perfect INFJ. About 15km from Forbidden City, 25 min by car.

attractions.name: PageOne Bookstore Sanlitun
attractions.location: Building 2, Taikoo Li Sanlitun South, 19 Sanlitun Lu
attractions.notes: FREE. 'Most beautiful bookstore of Beijing'. Huge English books range, design/art books, children's literature. Wood-clad design by lllab studio. Perfect INFJ spot.

attractions.name: POP MART Beijing Flagship
attractions.notes: €10-20 budget. 189 sqm flagship store. Exclusive collectibles, Sonny Angel, blind boxes.

attractions.name: Metal Hands Coffee
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. One of first 'hipster' coffee shops in Beijing. Nordic interior. Famous nitrogen cold brew.

attractions.name: Barista Coffee Roasters
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. One of first new-wave cafés in Beijing. In-house roasted beans. Some of best brews in city. Hidden hutong gem.

attractions.name: Tianjin Day Trip - Five Great Avenues (天津五大道)
attractions.location: Tianjin (30 min by high-speed train from Beijing)
attractions.notes: OPTIONAL full-day trip. FREE to walk (transport ~€20 round-trip HSR). 2,000+ European villas from former concessions. Five avenues: Chengdu, Munan, Machang, Dali, Chongqing Dao. Italian, German, French, Spanish, British architecture. 'Museum of architectures'. Very niche, INFJ-friendly.

attractions.name: Tianjin - Italian Style Street (意大利风情街)
attractions.notes: OPTIONAL. FREE. ONLY Italian concession in the world. 200+ preserved European buildings. Marco Polo Square, Jai Alai Club. Combine with Five Avenues for full day.

attractions.name: RoOM Café
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Tucked in quiet alley. Refreshing greenery. Hidden hutong treasure.

attractions.name: Dark Hill Coffee
attractions.notes: €7 estimate. Specialty shop with up to 24 different beans daily. Pour-over enthusiasts. Yunnan jasmine-washed beans with natural floral aroma.

attractions.name: Zhuo'er Bookstore
attractions.notes: FREE. Minimalist bookshop-meets-gallery in Beijing's contemporary art village. Design-forward, thoughtful curation. Community culture focus. Very niche INFJ. Note: may be far from city center.

attractions.name: One Way Space (单向空间)
attractions.notes: FREE. Operating since 2006. Independent bookstore with cultural events. English books. Intellectual atmosphere, perfect contemplative INFJ.

attractions.name: Berrybeans Coffee
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Hidden gem in old Beijing. Extensive pour-over menu. Perfect INFJ atmosphere.

attractions.name: Voyage Coffee
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. 'Easily the best coffee we have had in China'. Cool place. Worth the visit.

attractions.name: Temple of Heaven (天坛)
attractions.notes: ~80 RMB (€10). UNESCO World Heritage. Imperial sacrificial altar, beautiful architecture. Large park where locals practice tai chi, dance, music. Authentic local experience, less touristy than Forbidden City.

attractions.name: Gulou Area (鼓楼)
attractions.notes: Drum & Bell Tower ~60 RMB (€8). Hidden creative corners, specialist shops, hutong hideaways. Niche boutiques, local cafes. Authentic Beijing neighborhood vibe.

attractions.name: Summer Palace (颐和园)
attractions.notes: ~90 RMB (€12). UNESCO World Heritage. Vast imperial garden with Kunming Lake, pavilions, Long Corridor. Beautiful architecture and landscapes. Best in good weather. Less crowded than Forbidden City.

attractions.name: Lama Temple (雍和宫)
attractions.notes: ~60 RMB (€8). Beautiful active Tibetan Buddhist temple. Stunning architecture, 18m giant Buddha statue. Peaceful atmosphere, incense. Authentic spiritual experience. Near Nanluoguxiang.

attractions.name: Confucius Temple (孔庙)
attractions.notes: ~45 RMB (€6). Peaceful temple dedicated to Confucius. Ancient cypress trees, stone tablets. Quiet contemplative atmosphere. Combine with Lama Temple visit.

attractions.name: Tian Roast Coffee Co.
attractions.location: Entrance of 798 Art District, hidden in alley
attractions.notes: €6 estimate. Hidden gem with cool ambiance. Quality beans. Tucked away location makes it special.

attractions.name: Jingshan Park (景山公园)
attractions.location: Directly north of Forbidden City, Dongcheng District
attractions.notes: ~20 RMB (€3). Climb to pavilion at top for BEST panoramic views of Forbidden City and Beijing. Former imperial garden. Beautiful in any season, great for photos. Inexpensive.

attractions.name: Beihai Park (北海公园)
attractions.notes: ~35 RMB (€5). Ancient imperial garden with Beihai Lake, White Pagoda. Peaceful atmosphere, boat rentals (weather permitting). Beautiful scenery, locals practicing calligraphy, music. Authentic relaxed Beijing experience.

critical_booking_requirements.forbidden_city: MUST book online 1-7 days in advance at bookingticket.dpm.org.cn - NO walk-up tickets allowed. Foreigners can now book with passport + email. Often sells out weeks ahead during peak season. Daily limit 40,000 visitors.
critical_booking_requirements.panda_base: MUST book 14 days in advance via WeChat Official Account, Trip.com, Meituan, or Douyin APP. Daily limit 60,000 (30k morning/30k afternoon). Arrive 7:30-10:00 for best feeding time and most active pandas.
critical_booking_requirements.shanghai_disneyland: Book online in advance - tickets sell out on high-demand dates. February is low season with cheapest tickets 475-550 RMB. Flexible refund policy started Jan 12, 2026. Early Park Entry Pass available for +149 CNY.

top_niche_picks: TESTBED2 Arts Center (Chongqing) - creative hub with 100+ unique businesses
Eling Park (Chongqing) - peaceful 360° viewpoint, locals-only gem
Tianzifang (Shanghai) - labyrinthine art district in shikumen architecture
iRen Study (Shanghai) - 24hr MBTI-themed tiny bookstore for introverts
Museum of Art Pudong (Shanghai) - Jean Nouvel design, top-floor Bund views
Zhuo'er Bookstore (Beijing) - minimalist gallery-bookshop in art village
798 Art District (Beijing) - 200 galleries in former factory complex
Barista Coffee Roasters (Beijing) - hidden hutong gem, in-house roasting

notes.geographic_optimization: Attractions grouped by area to minimize travel time. Chongqing: Yuzhong District cluster. Shanghai: Bund/French Concession walkable. Beijing: Forbidden City/hutong cluster; 798/Sanlitun cluster; Temple circuit.
notes.weather_considerations: February is low season, winter weather. Indoor backup options included: museums, bookstores, cafes. Outdoor activities: parks, hutongs, waterfront walks - dress warmly.
notes.authentic_local_experiences: Focused on niche, fancy spots locals love but foreigners rarely find. Hidden creative parks, independent bookstores, specialty coffee hideaways, former concession areas, art districts. Avoided mass tourism traps.

cute_shopping_locations.pop_mart: Shanghai: Nanjing Road/IFC Flagship (2 levels). Beijing: Sanlitun Village Flagship (189 sqm). Budget €10-20 per visit.
cute_shopping_locations.sonny_angel: Shanghai: Foreign language bookstore areas. Beijing: Sanlitun area. New Strawberry Love Series launched Jan 22, 2026. Budget €15-25.

specialty_coffee_culture.shanghai: World's coffee capital - 9,533+ shops. Mix of hidden French Concession spots and waterfront cafes. Avg €5-7 per specialty coffee.
specialty_coffee_culture.beijing: Historic hutongs are treasure trove. Nordic-inspired designs, in-house roasters. Avg €6-7 per specialty coffee.
specialty_coffee_culture.top_picks: Metal Hands Coffee (Top 50 Worldwide), Rumors Coffee Roastery (Shanghai), Barista Coffee Roasters (Beijing hutong)

english_bookstores.shanghai: Garden Books (widest selection), Shanghai Foreign Language Book Store (entire building), iRen Study (24hr MBTI-themed), Banana Fish (art publications)
english_bookstores.beijing: PageOne Sanlitun (most beautiful), One Way Space (since 2006), Zhuo'er Bookstore (gallery-bookshop)

notes.visa_info: China's 30-day visa-free policy extended until December 31, 2026. Beijing-Tianjin-Hebei: 240-hour (10-day) visa-free for 54 countries including Canada, US, all EU.
notes.cost_notes: All costs in EUR per person. FREE attractions emphasized for budget optimization. Total attraction costs well within €1,000 trip budget.
